title: Imaging Report - Sarah Miller radiology data
content:
**Imaging Study:** Imaging - Sarah Miller radiology data

**Patient:** Sarah Miller (MRN: MC-001001)
**Date:** October 21, 2025
**Study Type:** Imaging

**Clinical Indication:**
Evaluation for suspected drug-induced liver injury (DILI) secondary to methotrexate toxicity.

**Technique:**
Standard imaging imaging protocol performed.

**Findings:**
• Liver: Hepatomegaly with increased echogenicity consistent with steatosis
• Liver measures 18 cm in craniocaudal dimension (upper limit normal 16 cm)
• Parenchyma shows diffusely increased echogenicity
• No focal lesions, masses, or cysts identified
• Portal vein patent with normal hepatopetal flow
• Main portal vein diameter: 11 mm (normal)
• Hepatic veins patent
• Gallbladder: Normal wall thickness, no stones or sludge
• Common bile duct: Normal caliber at 4 mm
• Spleen: Normal size (10 cm) and echotexture
• Kidneys: Bilateral normal size and echotexture, no hydronephrosis
• No ascites identified

**Impression:**
1. Hepatomegaly with diffuse increased echogenicity suggesting hepatic steatosis
2. Findings compatible with drug-induced liver injury
3. No focal hepatic lesions identified
4. No biliary dilatation or gallstones

**Recommendations:**
• Clinical correlation with liver function tests recommended
• Follow-up imaging in 6-8 weeks to assess response to treatment modifications
• Consider hepatology consultation for further management

**Radiologist:** Dr. Johnson, MD
**Report Date:** October 21, 2025
